question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Simplify $3\cdot\frac{11}{4}\cdot \frac{16}{-55}$.
inference:
$$3\cdot\frac{11}{4}\cdot \frac{16}{-55} =$$

$$\frac{3\cdot11\cdot16}{-4\cdot55} =$$

$$\frac{528}{-220} = $$

$$- \frac{12}{5} =$$

Final Answer: $\boxed{ \frac{12}{5} }$ I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
Note that 55 and 11 have a common factor of 11. Also, 4 and 16 have a common factor of 4. Since there is one negative sign among all the factors, our result will be negative. We get \[
3\cdot\frac{11}{4}\cdot \frac{16}{-55}=-3\cdot\frac{\cancel{11}}{\cancel{4}}\cdot \frac{\cancelto{4}{16}}{\cancelto{5}{55}} \quad =-\frac{3\cdot 4}{5}=\boxed{-\frac{12}{5}}.
\]

ground_truth:
Note that 55 and 11 have a common factor of 11. Also, 4 and 16 have a common factor of 4. Since there is one negative sign among all the factors, our result will be negative. We get \[
3\cdot\frac{11}{4}\cdot \frac{16}{-55}=-3\cdot\frac{\cancel{11}}{\cancel{4}}\cdot \frac{\cancelto{4}{16}}{\cancelto{5}{55}} \quad =-\frac{3\cdot 4}{5}=\boxed{-\frac{12}{5}}.
\]
